title: Bondi shooting victims remembered by families | 7NEWS
description: Six people were killed in a shooting at Bondi, including Adam Smyth, a 50-year-old father of four who was walking with his wife, husband and wife Boris and Sofia Gurman, French citizen Dan Elkayam, Marika Pogany who migrated to Australia in 1968, and Rabbi Eli Schlanger who left behind five children. Families of the victims have shared memories of their loved ones as floral tributes grow at the Bondi pavilion. A fundraiser for Rabbi Schlanger's family is approaching one million dollars. title: Bondi reopens after shooting massacre | 7NEWS
description: Bondi Beach reopened to the public for the first time since Sunday's shooting massacre, drawing crowds of mourners to the crime scene locations including the footbridge where gunmen opened fire. Survivor Arsen Ostrovsky, who suffered a bullet wound to the head, returned to ask the community to light candles at 6:47 each night during Hanukkah in honour of the victims. First responders, NRL players from the Roosters, and families gathered at a makeshift memorial as the community continues searching for answers. title: Terror attack at Bondi Hanukkah celebrations | 7NEWS
description: A terror attack unfolded at Bondi Beach during Hanukkah by the Sea celebrations, where two gunmen parked a silver Hyundai with a homemade Islamic State-style flag and opened fire on families and children. Boris and Sophia Gurman were killed trying to confront the attackers, while Ahmed El Ahmed wrestled a weapon away from gunman Sajid Akram before Detective Senior Constable Cesar Baratza shot both attackers, killing one and injuring the other. title: Terror arrests as Sydney mourns Bondi victims | 7NEWS
description: Counter-terrorism police arrested seven men in Western Sydney after intelligence reports suggested they were planning a violent act, potentially targeting Bondi or other Sydney locations. The arrests come as Australia continues to mourn the victims of the recent Bondi attack, with funerals held for 10-year-old Matilda and 87-year-old Alex Kleitman, while hero Ahmed Al-Amed received $2.5 million in donations from supporters worldwide. The Prime Minister announced new hate speech legislation and stronger penalties for extremist behaviour in response to the tragedy. title: Qld man sentenced to 12 years in Bali prison for drug trafficking
description: An Indonesian court has sentenced Australian citizen Lamar Ahchee to 12 years in prison after finding him guilty of smuggling cocaine to the tourist island of Bali. #police #charge #bali #court #prison

title: Teenagers return for second day of brawling
description: Police have used pepper spray to control crowds after hundreds of Melbourne teenagers returned to Mordialloc beach for a second day of fighting. #teenager #police #melbourne #pepperspray #mordialloc

title: Doctor found guilty of poisoning and killing dozens of patients
description: French anaesthetist Frederic Pechier has been found guilty of poisoning 30 patients with potassium, killing 12 people. #doctor #doctordeath #france #guilty #anaesthetist

title: Paddle out held for Bondi terror attack victims
description: Mourners paddled out at Bondi Beach to remember the victims killed there on Sunday. A minute of silence was held by those heading out from the North Bondi Surf Club, as part of the moving tribute scheduled from 6.30am. #bondi #paddleout #northbondi #bondibeach #tribute

title: Victorian crime hits decade high | 7NEWS
description: More than a quarter of a million Victorians fell victim to crime in the past year, representing the highest crime rates in a decade with 30,000 more reports than the previous year. Aggravated home invasions have doubled over the last 10 years with 22 occurring per night, while car thefts average 90 per day at levels not seen since 2002. Youth crime statistics show approximately 1,200 children in Victoria have each been arrested around six times by police. title: Bondi community unites in paddle out tribute | 7NEWS
description: Hundreds of people gathered at Bondi Beach for a paddle out tribute to honour the 15 victims of a recent anti-Semitic terrorist attack. Australian Olympic team members, including Amy Fox, joined the community gathering to lay flowers and pay their respects at the Bondi Pavilion. The Prime Minister has announced new hate speech laws targeting preachers who promote violence, with tougher visa rejection powers and a new task force to combat anti-Semitism in education. title: Royal family releases annual Christmas card
description: The royal family have released their annual Christmas card as King Charles unveiled a new Guinness brewery in London. #royals #royalfamily #kingcharles #christmas #london

title: Private jet crashes on runway in North Carolina, killing seven people
description: A private jet has gone up in flames after crashing on the runway at a regional airport in North Carolina, killing seven people. Flight records show the plane was registered to a company run by retired NASCAR driver Greg Biffle. #plane #jet #aviation #crash #northcarolina

title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announces national gun buyback scheme
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced the federal government will establish a national firearm buyback scheme following Sunday's terror attack at Bondi Beach. The scheme will aim to purchase surplus newly banned and illegal firearms and will be the largest of its kind since the Howard government initiated one in 1996 in the wake of the Port Arthur tragedy. #bondi #bondibeach #albo #albanese #auspol
